summary: This is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys discussing the withholding of video evidence (from July 23 and August 9/10) in response to a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails indicate the request originated from the Tartaglione defense team and cite legal justification under 'Noel' for withholding the materials.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, discussing the withholding of video evidence under the 'Noel' justification in response to an Epstein-related FOIA request.

events.title: Email discussion on withholding Epstein video
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys correspond about withholding video evidence from July 23 and August 9/10 in response to a FOIA request, citing the 'Noel' justification.

keyFacts: Video evidence from July 23 and August 9/10 related to Jeffrey Epstein was being withheld from a FOIA request.
The FOIA request for the July 23 video originated from the defense team for Tartaglione.
The legal justification cited for withholding the video evidence is 'Noel'.
The correspondence reveals internal DOJ discussions about what Epstein-related materials to release publicly.
